resources.string:
What is Carbon Footprint?

 Carbon footprint is the impact of human activities measured in terms of the area of biologically productive land and water required to produce the goods consumed and to assimilate the carbon wastes generated. Carbon wastes, in other words, Greenhouse gases are measured in CO2e. They directly contribute to climate change.

 There are many different CO2e contributors, such as cars, and heating systems in buildings. But did you know, that food is also a source of CO2e? Our GreenFoodChallenge app measures how much CO2e your diet produces and helps discover how much you can save by making dietary adjustments! Find out what you can do to save Earth!
